intro: Distichia andina, commonly known as the Andean feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are often adorned with delicate, feathery bracts. Distichia andina thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of high-altitude ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional uses in Andean communities.
